title: JavawhileKeyword

metadata.description: Learn about JavawhileKeyword with clear explanations and practical examples.

content_sections.title: Details
content_sections.content:
Example
In the example below, the code in the loop will run, over and over again, as long as 
a variable
i
is less than 5:
int i = 0;
while (i < 5) {
  System.out.println(i);
  i++;
}

Definition and Usage
The
while
loop loops through a block of code as long as a specified condition is
true
.
Note:
Do not forget to increase the variable used in the condition, otherwise 
the loop will never end!
More Examples
The
do/while
loop is a variant of the
while
loop. This loop will 
execute the code block once, before checking if the condition is true, then it will
repeat the loop as long as the condition is true:
Example
int i = 0;
do {
  System.out.println(i);
  i++;
}
while (i < 5);

Related Pages
Read more about while loops in our
Java While Loop Tutorial
.

★
+1

practice_exercises.description: Create a function that demonstrates the concepts from this tutorial.

quiz.question:
What is as long as 
a variable
i?

What is Definition and Usage
The
while
loop loops through a block of code as long as a specified condition?
quiz.explanation:
The correct definition of Definition and Usage
The
while
loop loops through a block of code as long as a specified condition is 'true'.

summary: This tutorial covers JavawhileKeyword concepts and techniques. You'll learn how to use JavawhileKeyword effectively, including key principles, common patterns, and practical examples. By the end of this tutorial, you'll have a solid understanding of JavawhileKeyword and how to apply it in your projects.
